conversation.content: [whispering] Por favor, não desligue os amplificadores hoje à noite, as vibrações daqueles Marshalls velhos são a única coisa que me mantém viva. [pause] Eu tô morando nas vigas do seu venue há 3 meses, me alimentando das ondas sonoras que vocês deixam vibrando durante a noite.
Jesus Cristo, que porra é essa—pera, você é a coisa que fica mexendo no meu gear? [shaky voice] Eu achei que tava ficando louca, finding the amps in different positions every morning.

[apologetic] Eu tentei não mexer em nada, mas às vezes preciso me pressionar contra as caixas pra absorver as frequências direito. [very quietly] Your '68 Plexi head produz os overtones mais nutritivos que já encontrei.
[confused] Você tá me dizendo que come som? [pause] E que você especificamente precisa dos meus vintage amps ligados a noite toda pra sobreviver?

[desperately] Não qualquer som—tem que ser analógico, quente, with natural tube distortion. [sighs] Amplificadores digitais são tipo veneno pro meu tipo, and yours are the only pure ones left in the city.
[frustrated] Você faz ideia de quanto essas contas de luz tão custando pro venue? [exhales] Meu chefe tá ameaçando me demitir há semanas por causa do consumo de energia overnight.
[sadly] Eu sei, eu escutei você no telefone com ele, implorando pra manter seu emprego. [trailing off] Por isso que tô finalmente me revelando—não posso deixar você perder tudo por minha causa...
[bitter] Então o quê, você vai simplesmente achar outro venue pra assombrar? [quietly] Me deixar aqui pra explicar por que as contas de luz de repente caíram depois de meses de picos misteriosos?

[very melancholic] Não existem outros venues com seu equipamento, com seu jeito particular de ajustar o bias naqueles tubes. [whispering] Sem seus amplificadores, I'll slowly starve over the course of maybe 2 weeks.
[firmly] Para. Só para.

[anxious] Eu posso te ajudar em troca—eu escuto tudo que acontece nesse prédio, every conversation, every deal. [quickly] O dono tá desviando dinheiro dos lucros do bar, não é o consumo de energia que tá causando os problemas financeiros.
[curious] Você tá dizendo que o Thompson tá roubando? [pause] E você pode provar isso porque literalmente mora no teto e escuta tudo?

[confidently] Quintas à noite, depois dos shows, ele pega dinheiro do caixa antes da contagem. [whispering loudly] Eu posso te mostrar onde ele esconde—inside the broken Leslie cabinet in storage room B.
Mesmo se isso for verdade, como eu explico saber disso de repente? [sighs] Não posso exatamente dizer que uma criatura comedora de som das vigas me contou.

[warmly] Você poderia descobrir acidentalmente enquanto faz manutenção naquele Leslie. [pause] Você tá querendo consertar ele de qualquer jeito—I've heard you talking about restoring it for months now.
Isso é insano, completamente insano, mas eu realmente acredito em você. [exhales] Deus me ajude, I'm negotiating with a creature that eats guitar tones.
[relieved] Então você vai manter os amplificadores ligados? [very quietly] Eu prometo ter mais cuidado com seu equipamento, and I'll tell you anything suspicious I overhear.
[slowly] Vou deixar o JCM800 no canal limpo, volume baixo, durante a noite. [pause] Mas você tem que me ajudar a pegar o Thompson primeiro, and after that, we figure out a long-term solution.
[grateful] Obrigada, muito obrigada—o JCM800 vai me manter estável. [whispering] Nunca vou esquecer essa bondade de alguém que tinha todo motivo pra ter medo de mim.

[warmly] Só lembra disso quando tiver escutando minhas conversas com meu ex. [chuckle] E talvez me ajude a descobrir quais vintage pedals realmente valem a pena—you must have quite the ear for tone by now.

original_conversation.content: [whispering] Please don't turn off the amplifiers tonight, the vibrations from those old Marshalls are the only thing keeping me alive. [pause] I've been living in your venue's rafters for three months now, feeding on the sound waves you leave humming through the night.
Jesus Christ, what the hell are you—wait, you're the thing that's been moving my gear around? [shaky voice] I thought I was going crazy finding the amps in different positions every morning.

[apologetic] I tried not to disturb anything, but sometimes I need to press against the speakers to absorb the frequencies properly. [very quietly] Your '68 Plexi head produces the most nourishing overtones I've ever encountered.
[confused] You're telling me you eat sound? [pause] And you specifically need my vintage amps running all night to survive?
[desperately] Not just any sound—it has to be analog, warm, with natural tube distortion. [sighs] Digital amplifiers are like poison to my kind, and yours are the only pure ones left in the city.
[frustrated] Do you have any idea how much those electricity bills have been costing the venue? [exhales] My boss has been threatening to fire me for weeks because of the overnight power usage.
[sadly] I know, I've heard you on the phone with him, pleading to keep your job. [trailing off] That's why I'm finally revealing myself—I can't let you lose everything because of me...
[bitter] So what, you're just going to find another venue to haunt? [quietly] Leave me to explain why the power bills suddenly drop after months of mysterious spikes?

[very melancholic] There are no other venues with your equipment, with your particular way of setting the bias on those tubes. [whispering] Without your amplifiers, I'll slowly starve over the course of maybe two weeks.
[firmly] Stop. Just stop.

[anxious] I can help you in return—I hear everything that happens in this building, every conversation, every deal. [quickly] The owner's been embezzling from the bar profits, not your power usage that's causing the financial problems.
[curious] You're saying Thompson's been stealing? [pause] And you can prove this because you literally live in the ceiling and hear everything?

[confidently] Thursday nights, after the shows, he takes cash from the register before the count. [whispering loudly] I can show you where he hides it—inside the broken Leslie cabinet in storage room B.
Even if that's true, how do I explain suddenly knowing about it? [sighs] I can't exactly tell people a sound-eating creature from the rafters told me.
[warmly] You could accidentally discover it while doing maintenance on that Leslie. [pause] You've been meaning to fix it anyway—I've heard you talking about restoring it for months now.
This is insane, completely insane, but I actually believe you. [exhales] God help me, I'm negotiating with a creature that eats guitar tones.
[relieved] So you'll keep the amplifiers running? [very quietly] I promise to be more careful with your equipment, and I'll tell you anything suspicious I overhear.
[slowly] I'll run the JCM800 on the clean channel, low volume, overnight. [pause] But you have to help me nail Thompson first, and after that, we figure out a long-term solution.
[grateful] Thank you, thank you so much—the JCM800 will keep me stable. [whispering] I'll never forget this kindness from someone who had every reason to fear me.

[warmly] Just remember this when you're eavesdropping on my conversations with my ex. [chuckle] And maybe help me figure out which vintage pedals are actually worth the money—you must have quite the ear for tone by now.

scenario: A shapeshifting creature that feeds on sound vibrations has been living in a concert venue's rafters and approaches the guitar tech who's been leaving amplifiers on overnight, unknowingly providing the creature's only food source.
